articles.title: AIs can generate near-verbatim copies of novels from training data
articles.description: LLMs memorize more training data than previously thought.
articles.content: The worldâ€™s top AI models can be prompted to generate near-verbatim copies of bestselling novels, raising fresh questions about the industryâ€™s claim that its systems do not store copyrighted works. A series of recent studies has shown that large language models from OpenAI, Google, Meta, Anthropic, and xAI memorize far more of their training data than previously thought. AI and legal experts told the FT this â€œmemorizationâ€ ability could have serious ramifications on AI groupsâ€™ battle against doz
articles.author: Melissa HeikkilÃ¤, Financial Times

articles.title: Anthropic accuses DeepSeek and other Chinese firms of using Claude to train their AI
articles.description: Anthropic claims DeepSeek and two other Chinese AI companies misused its Claude AI model in an attempt to improve their own products. In an announcement on Monday, Anthropic says the "industrial-scale campaigns" involved the creation of around 24,000 fraudulent accounts and more than 16 million exch
articles.content: Anthropic claims DeepSeek and two other Chinese AI companies misused its Claude AI model in an attempt to improve their own products. In an announcement on Monday , Anthropic says the "industrial-scale campaigns" involved the creation of around 24,000 fraudulent accounts and more than 16 million exchanges with Claude, as reported earlier by The Wall Street Journal . The three companies - DeepSeek, MiniMax, and Moonshot - are accused of "distilling" Claude , or training a smaller AI model based o
articles.author: Emma Roth

Antitrust Division chief Gail Slater announced her departure suddenly, via a post on her personal X account. But to those
articles.content: In mid-February, the Department of Justice lost its head antitrust enforcer - just weeks before it was scheduled to argue one of the year's biggest anti-monopoly cases in court. Antitrust Division chief Gail Slater announced her departure suddenly, via a post on her personal X account. But to those who follow the agency closely, it was far from surprising. For months, leaks about the division described tensions between Slater and her team with DOJ leadership, and President Donald Trump's penchan
articles.author: Lauren Feiner

articles.content: Anthropic is issuing a call to action against AI "distillation attacks," after accusing three AI companies of misusing its Claude chatbot . articles.content: It's getting to be that time of year again. Summer Game Fest officially kicks off on June 5 and will go until June 8. articles.title: Billions of dollars later and still nobody knows what an Xbox is
articles.description: The last few years of Xbox have been expensive. Under Phil Spencer's leadership, Microsoft has spent billions of dollars in an attempt to build an ambitious future for gaming that looks a lot like Netflix. And while its subscription service Game Pass started out as a good deal for gamers (although n
articles.content: The last few years of Xbox have been expensive. Under Phil Spencer's leadership, Microsoft has spent billions of dollars in an attempt to build an ambitious future for gaming that looks a lot like Netflix. And while its subscription service Game Pass started out as a good deal for gamers ( although now not so much ), that spending spree has led to catastrophic layoffs, studio closures, and confused and inconsistent messaging about what Xbox actually stands for. And with Spencer set to retire as
articles.author: Andrew Webster

But , I also wanted to play that game in its full 4K glory, with none of the compromises of today's
articles.content: Mafia: The Old Country demands to be played on an enormous screen. As much as I love my 32-inch Alienware OLED gaming monitor , it doesn't do justice to Mafia's cinematic vistas of Sicily. But , I also wanted to play that game in its full 4K glory, with none of the compromises of today's game consoles. So why not just shove a tiny gaming desktop under my home theater? Enter the Fragbox , Falcon Northwest's revamped small form factor gaming PC. While it's very expensive, start

articles.title: How Do You Prove What Happened in a Dev Session? Dev Containers + eBPF + Signed Proofs
articles.description: Introduction Modern dev workflows are increasingly assisted by AI agents, helper scripts, and IDE extensions. That makes one thing harder than it used to be: proving what actually happened during a development session . Not just what code was produced, but: what processes ran what wrote to the works
articles.content: Introduction Modern dev workflows are increasingly assisted by AI agents, helper scripts, and IDE extensions. That makes one thing harder than it used to be: proving what actually happened during a development session . Not just what code was produced, but: what processes ran what wrote to the workspace and which commit that work belongs to This is the gap I wanted to address with SessionAttested : a policy-based development-session attestation framework that uses host-side eBPF to observe exec
articles.author: Shizuku

articles.content: Last week's surprise departure of Phil Spencer from Microsoft led to the promotion of Asha Sharma, who comes to head Microsoft's gaming division after two years as president of the company's CoreAI Product group . Despite that recent history, Sharma says in a new interview that she has "no tolerance for bad AI" in game development. articles.author: Kyle Orland
